data.title: Infantry unable to attack enemies in their LOS
data.body:
Noticed this today while playing Allies_02.

Tanya, as well as E3s and other units, are unable to attack enemies which are in the respective Line of Sight.

The problem is, that while right clicking on enemy infantry, tanya doesn't do anything. She won't attack.

The "solution" to this is to move her one step closer. Though it isn't a real solution, she manages to kill it then.

Similar stuff happened with E3s trying to destroy a flametower.

I find this bug extremely annoying. Hope some1 else noticed it too.

data.title: Update OpenRA.Game/Game.cs
data.body: Fix useless calculation of the same value in cycle

data.title: Game is running in slow motion
data.body:
I have a new subnotebook and now OpenRA has a huge performance issue in the renderer.

```
OpenGL renderer string: Mesa DRI Intel(R) Ivybridge Mobile x86/MMX/SSE2
```

The green render line in the performance graph is above the scale (outside of the box) and spikes occasionally.

It uses constantly 25% of the CPU and 180 MiB (4%) RAM. Setting it to a higher priority (nice) does not effect anything.

Modifying OpenRA's graphics settings does not change anything, too.

Updating Mono from 2.10.6 to 2.10.9 did not help.

I also disabled VSYNC for KDE and at `~/.drirc`

```
<device screen="0" driver="dri2">
    <application name="all">
    <option name="vblank_mode" value="0"/>
    </application>
</device>
```

glxgears gives >1800 FPS so I guess it is off.

OpenRA seems to be the only game that is effected. I tried https://www.urbanterror.info/ 4.2 (based on ioQuake3 engine) and it runs smoothly.

I also tried http://manicdigger.sourceforge.net which is a C# MineCraft clone that uses OpenTK. It runs very fluently with 100 FPS so I guess this is an OpenRA bug.

data.title: Feature request:suggest another map
data.body: In the game lobby, a button for "suggest another map" could suggest another map that suits how many players there are in the lobby. You should be able to press it more times, and it shows map with current player number spawns, and also those with more spawns later on...

data.title: Starting from network drive fails
data.body:
installed openRA on a windows harddisk, run it successfully (the neccessary files are present in my documents)
then copied all files on a usb stick, everything works
then copied all files on a network drive -> it fails

the content of the exception.log:

System.IO.FileLoadException: Die Datei oder Assembly "OpenRA.Mods.RA, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null" oder eine Abhängigkeit davon wurde nicht gefunden. Die minimale Berechtigung konnte nicht erteilt werden. (Ausnahme von HRESULT: 0x80131417) 
 Dateiname: "OpenRA.Mods.RA, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null" ---> System.Security.Policy.PolicyException: Erforderliche Berechtigungen wurden nicht erhalten. 
    bei System.Security.SecurityManager.ResolvePolicy(Evidence evidence, PermissionSet reqdPset, PermissionSet optPset, PermissionSet denyPset, PermissionSet& denied, Boolean checkExecutionPermission) 
    bei System.Security.SecurityManager.ResolvePolicy(Evidence evidence, PermissionSet reqdPset, PermissionSet optPset, PermissionSet denyPset, PermissionSet& denied, Int32& securitySpecialFlags, Boolean checkExecutionPermission) 
    bei System.Reflection.Assembly.nLoadFile(String path, Evidence evidence) 
    bei System.Reflection.Assembly.LoadFile(String path) 
    bei OpenRA.ObjectCreator..ctor(Manifest manifest) 
    bei OpenRA.ModData..ctor(String[] mods) 
    bei OpenRA.Game.InitializeWithMods(String[] mods) 
    bei OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args) 
    bei OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) 
    bei OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: Feature request: admin command to randomize teams
fix #2407; Character \# cannot be escaped in settings file
ported renderer to OpenTK
data.body: I started to port the renderer to http://www.opentk.com/ the successor of the Tao Framework. To my knowledge this does not fix any issues, but at least the code is more readable and does not rely on unmaintained software.

data.title: Character # cannot be escaped in settings file
data.body:
What happened:

Using character # in the settings file will mark rest of the line as a comment. This cannot be escaped with character .

What was expected:

That the # character is treated just like any other character when escaped with \

Other:

This would be useful with values ServerName and (not yet merged) DedicatedMOTD

data.title: Queuing in build menu causes you to set spawn movement flag when menu is over that building.
Attack radius, building placement, and chat impossible to read on snow maps
data.body: Attack radius, building placement, and chat impossible to read on snow maps. It would be nice if the placement and attack radius of turrents/teslas/etc were a color that contrasted with white.

data.title: Con. Yard neutralizing when undeploying during engineer capture.
data.body: Enemy will try to capture Construction yard with engineer as the player is undeploying to save it from being captured. Construction yard undeploys but turns neutral in the process rendering it useless to both sides.

data.title: Use Mono.Nat for UPnP port forwarding.
data.body: https://github.com/mono/Mono.Nat is a MIT licensed library created for http://www.monotorrent.com/ I guess it is superior to the code snippet used before. Tested with AVM Fritz!Box. It never crashes the game (tried UPnP disabled, UPnP port forwarding disabled and UPnP port forwarding set to allowed at router) and forwards both external and internal port now. It also searches for a device only once at game start while loading the mounting the files and loading the shellmap (which takes some time) so it does not slow down the lobby entering when creating a server.

data.title: new interior map by sunny_s: room-warzone
Volkov Changes
data.body:
This adds a new armor value to Volkov, called cybernetic. The main purpose of this is to make him easier to balance without messing up other units.

I also found out I accidentally slipped a personal mod in the voices file. I fixed that too.

PS: One of Scott's Commits fixed Mud's Crashing bug. So I am bringing it back in

data.title: Critical Bug: Armor Value for Infantry does not work
data.body: While testing out Volkov I noticed that his Heavy Armor is not applied. This is very critical, as it kills his balance. And it is a recent bug too. when I first started making him, this armor tag was working fine.

data.title: [wish] Play/Pause Forward/Rewind buttons when watching replays
data.body: I would like to see these buttons to be implemented. It would really spead up everyones learning curve ;)

data.title: Repaired permissions in /usr/share/openra
data.body:
Because of that it was crashing because of permission problems
When i was compiling and installing with make & make install 
I also written an issue about that

data.title: When compiling and installing -file access denied
data.body:
I a lot of times (on diferent distros) tried to compile openra & install by:
$ make all
$ sudo make install
And then when i want to run game
$ openra
It crashes and says that there is no access to /usr/share/openra etc

Of course i repaired it with chmod -R 755  /usr/share/openra

data.title: Issue with Mig+Airstrip

data.title: Specific Death Sounds for death types should be implemented
data.body:
Tiberian Dawn had a Gruesome death sound played when say an infantryman was blown to pieces by an SSM missile or a Napalm Bombing. I think that this engine should support it too, and I would be willing to take it a step further.

I recently pushed some of the unused death sounds to be implemented in C&C 1. They sound nice, but in certain cases, they don't fit. It isn't really fitting when an infantry man is blown to pieces by a tank shell and they just moan. So here would be my idea of the code:

GenericVoice: 
    Variants:
        nod: .v01,.v03
        gdi: .v01,.v03
    Voices:
        Select: await1,ready,report1,yessir1
        Move: ackno,affirm1,noprob,ritaway,roger,ugotit
        Die: nuyell1,nuyell3,nuyell4,nuyell5,nuyell6,nuyell7,nuyell10,nuyell11,nuyell12,yell1
    DisableVariants: Die

These are the death sounds I pushed for the next release. If my idea is implemented, then here would be my idea:

GenericVoice: 
    Variants:
        nod: .v01,.v03
        gdi: .v01,.v03
    Voices:
        Select: await1,ready,report1,yessir1
        Move: ackno,affirm1,noprob,ritaway,roger,ugotit
        Die: nuyell1,nuyell3,nuyell4,nuyell5
                       Variant2: yell1,nuyell5
What this does is that when Death Type 2 is played, it will only play yell1 and nuyell5. The current "die" would be used for the default if Variants are not defined. I didn't define Die5 for example. So it should play "Die" instead of "Varient5"

data.title: display player's ping in  game creating room
data.body:
To avoid lags, it would be very usefull to display player's ping. 

At example, when 12 players exists in the  room,  game must display the ping,  taking into account traffic, like if 12 players play the game.

Then game host can show and kick laggy player.

data.title: show a spot on radar for you team
data.body:
I would be nice to show a spot on radar for you team (like in "world of tanks"  game)

It will work the best, when you display radar in full-screen, pressing space key. 
(Like in Celtic Kings game: http://greatgamer.ru/images/screenshots/10483/screenshot_celtic_kings_the_punic_wars_1.jpg)

data.title: [bug] Color-Chooser disappears
data.body:
When trying to change your player color and someone else is trying to change his color too, then your color-chooser disappears.

It gets really frustrating when stuck waiting in a big multiplayer game and everyone fiddles around with their color...
